member.name: T:LightJson.JsonArray
member.summary: Represents an ordered collection of JsonValues.

member.name: P:LightJson.JsonArray.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of values in this collection.

member.name: P:LightJson.JsonArray.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value at the given index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the value to get or set.
member.remarks: The getter will return JsonValue.Null if the given index is out of range.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonArray.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.#ctor(LightJson.JsonValue[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonArray, adding the given values to the collection.
member.param: The values to be added to this collection.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.Add(LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Adds the given value to this collection.
member.param: The value to be added.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.AddIfNotNull(LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Adds the given value to this collection only if the value is not null.
member.param: The value to be added.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.Insert(System.Int32,LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Inserts the given value at the given index in this collection.
member.param: The index where the given value will be inserted.
The value to be inserted into this collection.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.InsertIfNotNull(System.Int32,LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Inserts the given value at the given index in this collection.
member.param: The index where the given value will be inserted.
The value to be inserted into this collection.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the value at the given index.
member.param: The index of the value to be removed.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.Clear
member.summary: Clears the contents of this collection.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.Contains(LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Determines whether the given item is in the JsonArray.
member.param: The item to locate in the JsonArray.
member.returns: Returns true if the item is found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.IndexOf(LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Determines the index of the given item in this JsonArray.
member.param: The item to locate in this JsonArray.
member.returns: The index of the item, if found. Otherwise, returns -1.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.ToString
member.summary: Returns a JSON string representing the state of the array.
member.remarks: The resulting string is safe to be inserted as is into dynamically generated JavaScript or JSON code.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonArray.ToString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a JSON string representing the state of the array.
member.remarks: The resulting string is safe to be inserted as is into dynamically generated JavaScript or JSON code.
member.param: Indicates whether the resulting string should be formatted for human-readability.

member.name: T:LightJson.JsonObject
member.summary: Represents a key-value pair collection of JsonValue objects.

member.name: P:LightJson.JsonObject.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of properties in this JsonObject.

member.name: P:LightJson.JsonObject.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the property with the given key.
member.param: The key of the property to get or set.
member.remarks: The getter will return JsonValue.Null if the given key is not assosiated with any value.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonObject.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a key with a null value to this collection.
member.param: The key of the property to be added.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.Add(System.String,LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Adds a value associated with a key to this collection.
member.param: The key of the property to be added.
The value of the property to be added.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.AddIfNotNull(System.String,LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Adds a value associated with a key to this collection only if the value is not null.
member.param: The key of the property to be added.
The value of the property to be added.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a property with the given key.
member.param: The key of the property to be removed.
member.returns: Returns true if the given key is found and removed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.Clear
member.summary: Clears the contents of this collection.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.Rename(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the key of one of the items in the collection.
member.remarks: This method has no effects if the oldKey does not exists. If the newKey already exists, the value will be overwritten.
member.param: The name of the key to be changed.
The new name of the key.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether this collection contains an item assosiated with the given key.
member.param: The key to locate in this collection.
member.returns: Returns true if the key is found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.ContainsKey(System.String,LightJson.JsonValue@)
member.summary: Determines whether this collection contains an item assosiated with the given key
member.param: The key to locate in this collection.
When this method returns, this value gets assigned the JsonValue assosiated with the key, if the key is found; otherwise, JsonValue.Null is assigned.
member.returns: Returns true if the key is found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.Contains(LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Determines whether this collection contains the given JsonValue.
member.param: The value to locate in this collection.
member.returns: Returns true if the value is found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through this collection.

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through this collection.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through this collection.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.ToString
member.summary: Returns a JSON string representing the state of the object.
member.remarks: The resulting string is safe to be inserted as is into dynamically generated JavaScript or JSON code.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonObject.ToString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a JSON string representing the state of the object.
member.remarks: The resulting string is safe to be inserted as is into dynamically generated JavaScript or JSON code.
member.param: Indicates whether the resulting string should be formatted for human-readability.

member.summary: Gets this value as a system.DateTime.

member.summary: Gets this (inner) value as a System.object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the specified key.

member.exception: Thrown when this JsonValue is not a JsonObject.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value at the specified index.

member.exception: Thrown when this JsonValue is not a JsonArray

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonValue.#ctor(LightJson.JsonValueType,System.Double,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JsonValue struct.
member.param: The Json type of the JsonValue.
The internal value of the JsonValue. This is used when the Json type is Number or Boolean.
The internal value reference of the JsonValue. This value is used when the Json type is String, JsonObject, or JsonArray.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonValue.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JsonValue struct, representing a Boolean value.
member.param: The value to be wrapped.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JsonValue struct, representing a Number value.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JsonValue struct, representing a String value.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JsonValue struct, representing a JsonObject.
member.param: The value to be wrapped.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonValue.#ctor(LightJson.JsonArray)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JsonValue struct, representing a Array reference value.
member.param: The value to be wrapped.

member.summary: Converts the given JsonArray into a JsonValue.

member.name: M:LightJson.JsonValue.op_Implicit(System.Nullable{System.DateTime})~LightJson.JsonValue
member.summary: Converts the given DateTime? into a JsonValue.
member.remarks: The DateTime value will be stored as a string using ISO 8601 format, since JSON does not define a DateTime type.
member.param: The value to be converted.

member.summary: Converts the given JsonValue into an Int.

member.summary: Converts the given JsonValue into a nullable Int.
member.param: The JsonValue to be converted.
member.exception: Throws System.InvalidCastException when the inner value type of the JsonValue is not the desired type of the conversion.

member.summary: Converts the given JsonValue into a Bool.

member.summary: An object value.

member.name: T:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a JSON message cannot be parsed.
member.remarks: This exception is only intended to be thrown by LightJson.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.Position
member.summary: Gets the text position where the error occurred.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of error that caused the exception to be thrown.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonParseException.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.#ctor(LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.ErrorType,LightJson.Serialization.TextPosition)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonParseException with the given error type and position.
member.param: The error type that describes the cause of the error.
The position in the text where the error occurred.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.#ctor(System.String,LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.ErrorType,LightJson.Serialization.TextPosition)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonParseException with the given message, error type, and position.
member.param: The message that describes the error.
The error type that describes the cause of the error.
The position in the text where the error occurred.

member.name: T:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.ErrorType
member.summary: Enumerates the types of errors that can occur when parsing a JSON message.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.ErrorType.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates that the cause of the error is unknown.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.ErrorType.IncompleteMessage
member.summary: Indicates that the text ended before the message could be parsed.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.ErrorType.DuplicateObjectKeys
member.summary: Indicates that a JsonObject contains more than one key with the same name.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.JsonParseException.ErrorType.InvalidOrUnexpectedCharacter
member.summary: Indicates that the parser encountered and invalid or unexpected character.

member.name: T:LightJson.Serialization.JsonReader
member.summary: Represents a reader that can read JsonValues.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonReader.Parse(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Creates a JsonValue by using the given TextReader.
member.param: The TextReader used to read a JSON message.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonReader.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a JsonValue by reader the JSON message in the given string.
member.param: The string containing the JSON message.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonReader.ParseFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a JsonValue by reading the given file.
member.param: The file path to be read.

member.name: T:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a JSON value cannot be serialized.
member.remarks: This exception is only intended to be thrown by LightJson.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of error that caused the exception to be thrown.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonSerializationException.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.#ctor(LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.ErrorType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonSerializationException with the given error type.
member.param: The error type that describes the cause of the error.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.#ctor(System.String,LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.ErrorType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonSerializationException with the given message and error type.
member.param: The message that describes the error.
The error type that describes the cause of the error.

member.name: T:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.ErrorType
member.summary: Enumerates the types of errors that can occur during serialization.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.ErrorType.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates that the cause of the error is unknown.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.ErrorType.InvalidNumber
member.summary: Indicates that the writer encountered an invalid number value (NAN, infinity) during serialization.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.ErrorType.InvalidValueType
member.summary: Indicates that the object been serialized contains an invalid JSON value type. That is, a value type that is not null, boolean, number, string, object, or array.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.JsonSerializationException.ErrorType.CircularReference
member.summary: Indicates that the object been serialized contains a circular reference.

member.name: T:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter
member.summary: Represents a TextWriter adapter that can write string representations of JsonValues.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.renderingCollections
member.summary: A set of containing all the collection objects (JsonObject/JsonArray) being rendered. It is used to prevent circular references; since collections that contain themselves will never finish rendering.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.IndentString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string representing a indent in the output.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.SpacingString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string representing a space in the output.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.NewLineString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string representing a new line on the output.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.SortObjects
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether JsonObject properties should be written in a deterministic order.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.InnerWriter
member.summary: Gets or sets the TextWriter to which this JsonWriter writes.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.#ctor(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonWriter.
member.param: The TextWriter used to write JsonValues.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.#ctor(System.IO.TextWriter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of JsonWriter.
member.param: The TextWriter used to write JsonValues.
A value indicating whether the output of the writer should be human-readable.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.GetJsonObjectEnumerator(LightJson.JsonObject)
member.summary: Gets an JsonObject enumarator based on the configuration of this JsonWriter. If JsonWriter.SortObjects is set to true, then a ordered enumerator is returned. Otherwise, a faster non-deterministic enumerator is returned.
member.param: The JsonObject for which to get an enumerator.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.Write(LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Writes the given value to the InnerWriter.
member.param: The JsonValue to write.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.Serialize(LightJson.JsonValue)
member.summary: Generates a string representation of the given value.
member.param: The value to serialize.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.JsonWriter.Serialize(LightJson.JsonValue,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates a string representation of the given value.
member.param: The value to serialize.
Indicates whether the resulting string should be formatted for human-readability.

member.name: T:LightJson.Serialization.TextPosition
member.summary: Represents a position within a plain text resource.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.TextPosition.column
member.summary: The column position, 0-based.

member.name: F:LightJson.Serialization.TextPosition.line
member.summary: The line position, 0-based.

member.name: T:LightJson.Serialization.TextScanner
member.summary: Represents a text scanner that reads one character at a time.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.TextScanner.Position
member.summary: Gets the position of the scanner within the text.

member.name: P:LightJson.Serialization.TextScanner.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there are still characters to be read.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.TextScanner.#ctor(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of TextScanner.
member.param: The TextReader to read the text.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.TextScanner.Peek
member.summary: Reads the next character in the stream without changing the current position.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.TextScanner.Read
member.summary: Reads the next character in the stream, advancing the text position.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.TextScanner.SkipWhitespace
member.summary: Advances the scanner to next non-whitespace character.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.TextScanner.Assert(System.Char)
member.summary: Verifies that the given character matches the next character in the stream. If the characters do not match, an exception will be thrown.
member.param: The expected character.

member.name: M:LightJson.Serialization.TextScanner.Assert(System.String)
member.summary: Verifies that the given string matches the next characters in the stream. If the strings do not match, an exception will be thrown.
member.param: The expected string.
